p.s: In the following I will be looking at the authorsauthor's use of stylistic devices and language to persuade the reader of his opinion that unions are harming the work industries and becoming useless.
The author often uses repetition to highlight the change, which has happened.
He often uses unions are no longer.
Brian Pollard uses the repetition to make clear that the unions have changed.
This shows that they once were something but now they are different and have changed.
This is a highlight of his opinion that unions are diffrentdifferent and no longer the same.
Moreover the author uses the repetition of words to describe power, such as power, powerful and greed.
He wants to make clear that the unionsunions' intentions are only power and especially power over others.
However when talking about the past, how it used to be, he uses positive adjectives, such as best, successful and essential.
These show that he really supported unions before they changed.
To define their change and diffrentdifferent intentions the author uses verbs in terms of laziness.
Their diffrentdifferent intentions are described with drop and lack, these verbs also highlight the change, which he states happened.

Brian doesn't use a lot of diffrentdifferent stylistic devices which shows that his strategy is to use repetionrepetition and a lot of adjectives to persuade and make others aware of his opinion and his stated issues.
All together Brian uses positive language when talking about the past and how it used to be.
But as soon as he talks about today and his opinion today, he uses negative language and repetition.
